enemies.name: Kago
enemies.note: Have to kago inside to take contact damage. For the purpose of farming this has 11 drops, little health and few invulnerabilities. Kagos are not truly immune to Bombs and PBs, but only yield 1 drop in that case.

enemies.name: Bull
enemies.note: A charged Power Beam does damage Bulls

enemies.name: Evir
enemies.note: Evirs are invulnerable to all beam combos involving ice (even charged shots) except if Plasma is involved

enemies.name: Mochtroid
enemies.note: Damages every 80 frames, keeps track of contact

enemies.name: Owtch
enemies.note: Invulnerable to all beams (even charged) except if Plasma is involved

enemies.name: Pink Space Pirate (standing)
enemies.note: Invulnerable to all beams (even charged) except if Plasma is involved. Can take damage from PseudoScrew, but that requires two hits so Samus must take damage once.

enemies.name: Dessgeega
enemies.note: Invulnerable to some beams, but charged Power Beam hurts it

enemies.name: Dragon
enemies.note: Invulnerable to some beams, but charged Power Beam hurts it

enemies.name: Kihunter (red)
enemies.note: Invulnerable to Power Beam and Wave, but charged Power Beam hurts it

enemies.name: Red Space Pirate (standing)
enemies.note: Invulnerable to Power Beam, but not to Charge

enemies.name: Space Pirate (fighting)
enemies.note: 100% immune while gray, but can be hit by a few weapons while yellow, including charged Power Beam

enemies.name: Metroid
enemies.note: Damage amounts are per 16 frames. Invulnerable to Missiles and Supers except when frozen. Killing requirements should be handled manually.

enemies.name: Rinka
enemies.note: They respawn but doesn't turn into any resources

enemies.name: Blue Sidehopper
enemies.note: The Sidehopper that the Super Metroid attacks deals 80/40/20 damage and does not drop items

enemies.name: Custom Climb Pirate
enemies.note: The only place these exist is in the climb during the escape sequence.

enemies.name: Trapped Atomic
enemies.note: It is possible to shoot many of these with PowerBeam but some refuse and it's ridiculous for farming purposes anyway.
